Posts.Content: shlee wrote: Hello, I had surgery 2nd week in Nov. for Stage I IDC + DCIS 1.2cm (Invasive at least 1.05 cm). Since i am at a very high volume cancer center, to get one of the top oncologists, i apparently have to wait until the second week in January to even get my first appt.!!!!!!!!  Well, considering the size of my tumor at least 1.05 cm Invasive, I read guidelines that say chemo is recommended. Considering I was given a grade of 2, then I am assuming chemo will work well on my cancer. I am waiting for the Oncotype test to come back, but I still don't understand how that can tell you whether or now there are circulating tumor cells that have already started to travel. I understand it tells the risk of cancer wanting to come back, but it doesn't seem to say the risk of whether or not you already have tumor cells circulating that should be killed by chemo.  I would really like to have the best oncologist by all accounts, but i also feel like at this cancer center they don't truly give a darn if waiting for chemo affects my survival. I heard that 12 wks after surgery is unsafe. I also heard that ideally should be started 6 weeks after surgery.  Anyway, i am very confused about what to do! What are your opinions? How long did you wait for chemo following surgery? I really don't want to have chemo but if it means never having to deal with this crap again i am more than willing to put up with 3 months of feeling sick! However, I also think 6 wks would put me right into the christmas and new years holidays... Dx 9/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
